article: ingredients1 package uncooked rotini pasta1 jar alfredo sauce 3 cups chicken stock2 cups diced rotisserie chicken or other diced cooked chicken2 teaspoons minced garlic2 cups shredded mozzarella or italian blend cheeseoptional : parmesan cheese and fresh chopped herbs such as basil , oregano , and parsley for garnishinstructionspreheat oven to 425 °f . in a large baking dish , stir together uncooked pasta , alfredo sauce , chicken stock , chicken , and garlic . cover tightly with aluminum foil and bake for 30 ; stir . at this point you should check the pasta to make sure that it is al dente .

i have had good luck with the 30-minute cook time ; however , some readers have noted that it required about 10 or 15 minutes longer . if it 's still too hard after 30 minutes , just cover the dish and return to the oven until pasta is al dente . then move on to the next mozzarella over the top . bake uncovered for 10 more minutes . garnish with freshly grated parmesan or fresh chopped herbs , if desired .
abstract: dump and bake chicken alfredo pasta casserole
